derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'a magical procedure'): from Old French magique, from Latin magicus (adjective), late Latin magica (noun), from Greek magikē (tekhnē) ('art of) a magus': magi were regarded as magicians

encyclopedia.content: 专辑信息 专 辑：Magic 歌 手：Twins 语 言：粤语专辑 发行日期：2004年01月14日 专辑介绍 Twins个唱《零4好玩演唱会》将于2003年大除夕开锣，最近再接再厉，推出儿歌精选及音乐录像专辑《Singing in the Twins Wonderland》，她们为了个唱除了准备主打快歌“零4 好玩”外，更塑造了印度look及魔术表演等健康兼全新的造型，使个唱老少咸宜，与大人及小朋友共度一个“好玩”的2004年！ 首批3D封面限量特别版，全碟11首好歌，加送一

entry.def: Magic is the power to use supernatural forces to make impossible things happen, such as making people disappear or controlling events in nature.

example.ex: ...the use of magic to combat any adverse powers or influences...
example.tran: 利用法术与强敌或敌对势力作战

entry.def: You can use magic when you are referring to an event that is so wonderful, strange, or unexpected that it seems as if supernatural powers have caused it. You can also say that something happens as if by magic or like magic .

example.ex: All this was supposed to work magic...
example.tran: 这一切被认为会创造奇迹。

example.ex: The picture will now appear, as if by magic!
example.tran: 这幅画立刻就会出现，好像变魔术一般！

entry.tran: (似)用魔法变成的;(似)用魔术变出的
entry.def: You use magic to describe something that does things, or appears to do things, by magic.

example.ex: ...the magic ingredient that helps to keep skin looking smooth.
example.tran: 有助于保持肌肤光滑的奇效成分

entry.def: Magic is the art and skill of performing mysterious tricks to entertain people, for example by making things appear and disappear.

example.ex: His secret hobby: performing magic tricks.
example.tran: 他私底下有变戏法的嗜好。

entry.def: If you refer to the magic of something, you mean that it has a special mysterious quality which makes it seem wonderful and exciting to you and which makes you feel happy.

example.ex: It infected them with some of the magic of a lost age...
example.tran: 逝去的岁月让他们平添了几分魅力。

example.ex: There can be a magic about love that defies all explanation...
example.tran: 爱情的魔力也许根本无法解释。

entry.def: If you refer to a person's magic, you mean a special talent or ability that they have, which you admire or consider very impressive.

example.ex: The fighter believes he can still regain some of his old magic.
example.tran: 这位斗士相信自己仍然可以恢复从前的一些魔力。

entry.tran: （数目、词语等）重要的，关键的，举足轻重的
entry.def: You can use expressions such as the magic number and the magic word to indicate that a number or word is the one which is significant or desirable in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...their quest to gain the magic number of 270 electoral votes on Election Day.
example.tran: 在大选之日他们对胜败攸关的270张选票的争取

example.ex: ...the magic word that opened doors onto private worlds.

entry.tran: 立见奇效的;立竿见影的
entry.def: Magic is used in expressions such as there is no magic formula and there is no magic solution to say that someone will have to make an effort to solve a problem, because it will not solve itself.

example.ex: There is no magic formula for producing winning products...
example.tran: 获奖电影的制作没有捷径可取。

entry.tran: 极好的;了不起的;非常棒的
entry.def: If you say that something is magic, you think it is very good or enjoyable.

example.ex: It was magic—one of the best days of my life.
example.tran: 真是太棒了——这是我生命中最美好的一天。

means.word_mean: 1. any art that invokes supernatural powers
2. an illusory feat; considered magical by naive observers
1. possessing or using or characteristic of or appropriate to supernatural powers;

Sentence.sentence: His product launches, at which he would stand alone on a black stage and produce as if by magic an "incredible" new electronic gadget （小器具）in front of an amazed crowd, were the performances of a master showman.
Mr Jobs, who died recently aged 56, spent his life packaging that magic into elegantly designed, easy-to-use products
But in the end he created a reality of his own, channeling the magic of computing into products that reshaped entire industries.
Another question invites them to write about the importance (to them, agai of diversity―a word that has assumed magic power in American higher education.

means.word_mean: 魔法, 法术; 巫术

sentences.en: They claimed that he had inflicted bad fortune on them through evil magic.
sentences.cn: 他们声称他运用了恶毒的魔法使他们遭受不幸。

sentences.en: They believe that it was all done by magic.
sentences.cn: 他们相信这都是靠魔法实现的。

sentences.en: The conjuror's magic delighted the children.
sentences.cn: 魔术师的戏法逗乐了孩子们。

sentences.en: You could feel the magic of Shakespeare's poetry.
sentences.cn: 你可以感觉到莎士比亚诗歌的魅力。

sentences.en: It is really a magic palace!
sentences.cn: 那真是一个有魔力的宫殿！

sentences.en: Their latest record is really magic.
sentences.cn: 他们的最新唱片真是棒极了。
